conversion_verification.notes: The 3D render successfully transforms the 2D floor plan into a perceptible 3D structure with visible wall height and thickness. The view is angled, and the roof is removed to expose the interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls have clear height (5), floors are separate planes (3), interior volume perceivable (4). Proper 3D wall corner geometry (3). Angled view (5), interior visible from elevated perspective (3). Minimal perspective distortion (2). Roof removed cleanly (5), interior fully visible (3). Geometry is clean (0, as some text is part of wall/floor geometry).

geometric_accuracy.notes: Correct number of rooms (3), correct adjacency (4), relative room proportions preserved (3), major room identities match (2). Major wall positions align (5), wall lengths proportional (3). Internal partitions correctly placed (2). Doors present and on correct walls (4), windows present and on correct walls (2). Openings proportionally sized and oriented, though some window details are simplified (0, 0, as some window details are simplified in the 3D, and door swings are not shown).

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (4), kitchen elements present (2), bathroom fixtures present (2). Furniture in correct rooms (3), scale reasonable (2). Orientation is logical for most items (1, not all orientations are perfect matches, e.g., shower in ENSUITE and BATHTUB in BATH).

visual_clarity.notes: Walls, floors, openings clearly distinguishable (4). Geometry is readable but text labels integrated into the 3D model reduce clarity (2). Interior clearly visible (3). Lighting does not obscure geometry (3). Consistent material usage (2). No rendering artifacts (2). Background is clean but the presence of 2D text labels from the original floor plan as textures on the 3D model detracts from optimal presentation (0).

detected_errors.description: 2D text labels from the original floor plan are integrated as textures on the 3D model's walls and floors, which impacts visual clarity and aesthetic coherence.

summary: The 3D render is a good transformation of the 2D floor plan, accurately representing the layout and most interior elements in an isometric cutaway view, though the inclusion of 2D text labels as textures on the 3D model detracts slightly from its overall quality.
